item.title: I Went to Prison and Found Support and Community
item.description: Unlike the version of prison conjured on TV and in the movies, I found a community quick to be generous and kind.

item.title: The Many Gifts of Kidney Donation
item.description: Readers respond to an Opinion essay by German Lopez about his decision to become a living kidney donor.

item.title: Is This the Most Important Supreme Court Case of the Century?
item.description: The tariff ruling may have just helped save the Republic.

item.title: The Bible Tells Us to Love Immigrants
item.description: The biblical moral revolution was to love those not of one’s own land.

item.title: Historians Confirm: Tomorrow Won’t Be Better Than Today
item.description: The human capacity for hope is an essential quality. But hope can also turn into delusion.

item.title: At the Olympics, I Saw the Difference Between Nationalism and Patriotism
item.description: Nationalism may be on the rise, but at the Olympics our shared humanity easily crossed borders.

item.title: Ukraine Has Passed a Point of No Return
item.description: Four years that changed everything.

item.title: Trump Is Banking on Iranian Weakness. That’s a Mistake.
item.description: Iran’s leaders may have hesitated at the start of the recent demonstrations, but the violent reaction that followed bespeaks a confident regime.

item.title: This Masculinity Influencer Is Loud and Wrong About Paternity Leave
item.description: Why are we still debating this topic?

item.description: The high court asserts itself as tariff sheriff.

item.description: What a declassification effort could help us resolve.

item.description: A Q & A with Andrea Pitzer.

item.title: The Former British Prince and the Very American Outrage
item.description: At least monarchies have developed limits on arbitrary power.

item.title: Epstein Was Only One of Thousands of Traffickers in the U.S.
item.description: Every year, more than 100,000 children may be sold for sex in the United States. Are we willing to do something about that?

item.description: Three Opinion writers on Iran, Epstein and what power really looks like.

item.description: It’s time to end the era of colorblind casting.

item.description: The Supreme Court has spoken. What now?

item.title: It’s a Dangerous, Sometimes Deadly, Sport. I Won’t Stop.
item.description: Skiing the backcountry remains essential to me — to find solace, recharge, sweat, laugh, cry and unplug from the ills of the world.

item.title: Jesse Jackson Was a Style Icon
item.description: Mr. Jackson was never worried about looking like he worked at a bank.

item.title: The Save America Act Is an Assault on Democracy
item.description: President Trump would have you think that voter fraud is rampant, says the Opinion columnist Jamelle Bouie. The reality? That’s just not true. So why are Trump and his allies so preoccupied with passing the Save America Act?

item.description: PEN America is no longer acting in the best traditions of its august history.

item.title: Will the Supreme Court’s Tariff Ruling Curb Trump?
item.description: What does this mean for the president, the economy — and your bank account?

item.title: Three Words That Shape Our Politics
item.description: Is Donald Trump “country” or “cowboy”? The Times Opinion columnist Tressie McMillan Cottom breaks down a cultural trend she sees shaping politics today.

item.title: Gessen and Polgreen on Prince Andrew and the Epstein Files
item.description: Don’t lose focus on the victims.

item.title: A ‘Gratifying’ Supreme Court Decision on Tariffs
item.description: Readers react to the Supreme Court decision overturning President Trump’s tariffs. Also: Former Prince Andrew’s arrest; trade pacts based on whims.

item.title: Mikaela Shiffrin’s Silent Victory
item.description: I savor the Olympic achievements that don’t make it into any record book.

item.title: Who Stands to Lose in the Birthright Citizenship Case
item.description: Until our Constitution is amended, our government is not allowed to punish the innocent babies guaranteed full and equal citizenship by the Constitution.

item.title: ICE Is Causing a Health Crisis
item.description: Our patients face a cruel calculus: seek essential medical care and risk detention, or stay home and risk their lives.

item.description: On the lookout for electoral overperformers.

item.title: This Is How an Autocrat Goes to War
item.description: All that matters to Trump is whether he thinks attacking Iran is in his interests.

item.description: The Atlantic staff writers Ashley Parker and Michael Scherer explain how Trump’s White House works.

item.title: How California Is Damaging Faith in Government
item.description: The slow counting of votes is a classic example of the perfect being the enemy of the good.

item.title: The Year Empathy Died
item.description: Compassion is not toxic.

item.title: Here’s What I Just Figured Out About the Way Trump Talks
item.description: Why just tell a story when you can put on a skit?

item.title: Donald Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ Convenes Its First Meeting
item.description: To anyone who spent time in the old U.S.S.R., President Trump’s newly hatched “Board of Peace” evokes worrying echoes.

item.title: What’s Behind Anti-Indian Backlash in America?
item.description: “Americans don’t know much about India,” says the international relations scholar Amitav Acharya. He tells Ross Douthat on “Interesting Times” that Indian dominance in Silicon Valley is another major factor.

item.title: Is the World Underestimating India?
item.description: India is the major power with the fastest-growing economy and the world’s largest population, but the international relations scholar Amitav Acharya argues on “Interesting Times” that the country doesn’t get the respect it’s looking for.

item.title: Welcome to the Indian Century
item.description: India is winning the standoff between America and China.

item.description: India is winning the standoff between America and China.

item.title: Kennedy’s MAHA Coalition Is a Mess
item.description: A political movement cannot survive on spite alone.

item.description: Readers respond to a news analysis about President Trump’s relentless demand for exaltation. Also: “Dirty money” from Jeffrey Epstein.

item.description: Three writers and an Olympic medalist on the grit and grace of the winter games.

item.description: When the U.S. plays Canada in the Olympic women’s final, there will be much more than a gold medal at stake.

item.description: There are a lot of potential contestants.

item.title: When a Government Tracks Its Opponents
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security’s tracking of opponents of ICE. Also: Antislavery Americans; Native American pain; hazing laws; sympathy from Canada.
